intro: Cacalia polycephala, commonly known as the many-headed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem. The flowers are usually blue or purple, with five petals that enclose a central cluster of stamens.
